fields.description:
Currently the only value allowed for the field Flagged is "Impediment" but this value may not be appropriate for some scenarios, as flagging an issue can be for a number of reasons rather than just being an impediment. 

The suggestion is to allow changing the value of the field to anything required by the admins.
fields.summary: Allow changing the value for the field Flagged

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In the backlog of a sprint managed project, currently only the Total original time estimate is shown. Please show the remaining estimate time as well to be displayed along with this.


h3. Suggested Solution
Please have a display icon showing the Total remaining estimate of all the issues just like the Total original time estimate.

h3. Why This Is Important
This helps customers to track the remaining time which is important to make decisions and act accordingly

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Display the Total remaining estimate time along with the Total original estimate on the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sprint Health Gadget not mapped to status categories
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Map several statuses to any of the existing Status from a project
 # Create a Dashboard and add the Sprint Health gadget

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should show all statuses (columns) in the bar
h3. Actual Results
Shows all statuses but ignores the first column

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget not mapped to status categories

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When clicking on "Create sprint", the sprint is created with a name based on the previous sprint.

In order to change the name, add a goal and the duration, it's necessary to edit the sprint.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the same option as Jira Server where a screen is shown to select such information before creating the sprint.

!Screen Shot 2021-06-24 at 13.22.43.png|width=435,height=292!
fields.summary: Ability to set details of a sprint upon creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to choose the user for the board administrator, it would not display the users names with profile picture and email addresses to differentiate between the users with same names but different email IDs present in the site. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 2 or 3 email accounts which has same name in the cloud site
 # Go to board settings -> try to type the name of the user
 # All the names will display, there is no way to identify which user we are mapping the privilege to.

h3. Expected Results

A profile picture and displaying the email address to differentiate between the profiles.
h3. Actual Results

The username is displayed with the same name twice or thrice based on the match. However, while choosing either of them, it would be difficult to differentiate to who are we assigning the permission to.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Add profile picture and email addresses to the users names when adding as Board administrator

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a custom Select List type field in your Plan, you can only select one of the options from the drop-down list but cannot perform a keyword search on the field. This is possible in Jira.

 !2021-06-24_15-13-48.gif|width=400&height=200! 

h3. Proposed solution

Allow keyword searches for custom Select List fields because the list can become very long and it would be less than ideal to have to scroll to the bottom.

 !2021-06-24_15-15-59.gif|width=400&height=200!
fields.summary: Allow keyword searches on the Select List field type

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

When typing in the Parent Link field on the issue view screen, the autocomplete will show you suggestions only if you typed a complete word, or a full issue key. If you only typed a few characters, no autosuggestions shown. 

The autocomplete works perfectly with the Summary text.

It would be nice to have to autocomplete work with issue key search as well.
fields.summary: Parent link autocomplete should work with issue key search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to access a URL from an issue that was deleted, the message displayed shows *Something's gone wrong* error message - which is not clear on the status of the issue. It should display a more accurate message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access a URL from a deleted issue.

h3. Expected Results
Some message like *"This issue does not exist"*.

h3. Actual Results
It displays a *Something's gone wrong* error message.
!Screen Shot 2021-06-23 at 12.56.40.png|width=387,height=198!

h3. Workaround
N/A.
fields.summary: Accessing the URL of a deleted issue display "Something's gone wrong" error message.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the New issue view .(dot) menu is not efficient, needs more clicks than what was needed in the Old issue view to perform any action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

To log work in the Old issue view, one needs to type . Log <enter> , type time <enter>. This would save the value entered.

The same action takes multiple mouse clicks, even when "Save" option is highlighted, pressing <enter> would not work, it needs to be saved by a mouse click. Customer is unhappy and believes that this is a regression.

An example of the difference : [^Screen Recording 2021-06-23 at 7.57.42 PM.mov]

This problem reported by the user is a continuation of JRACLOUD-71827
fields.summary: New issue view .(dot) menu is not efficient, needs more clicks than what was needed in the Old issue view to perform any action.

fields.description: Jira Cloud has the option to use dependency lines to the plan. This is incredibly useful to visualize how tasks and subtasks relate to each other. The dependency tab can be helpful to track dependencies across projects but is not helpful when tracking tasks in one project/one epic. This feature is needed in Jira Server so teams can move from excel or other programs that render their plans to Jira where all data and reporting can be kept in one place.
fields.summary: Add Dependency Line to Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the roll-up, the parent level shows a total sum of every child issue including issues not seen in the Scope view because of filters applied which is sometimes not useful information to have.

In the example below, we see a roll-up on the Epic of 50 points when with the filter applied it should just be 15.

 !TST7_SCRUM_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

The roll-up should exclude issues being filtered out or at least provide a check-box option to include or exclude these issues, much like the "Show full hierarchy" check-box.

 !bug1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to exclude issues from roll up when using filters

fields.description:
Currently Advanced Roadmap Dependencies Report shows Initiative dependencies as well as their child issues with their related dependency and there is no option to filter by issue type. 

For example, there is currently no way to only show Initiative level dependencies.

Please add the option to reflect dependencies based on issue type selected

Workaround: 
Create a new plan with only Initiatives in that and then look at the dependency report.
fields.summary: Dependencies Report to filter by issue Type

fields.description:
When a Version or Epic filter is applied to the backlog, it could be confusing to identify what is the filter being applied.

See attached video as an example
fields.summary: As a user I'd like to have a better view of the filter applied to the Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a roadmap (plans) takes more than 10 seconds to load on Jira, it will fail to load when embedded in a Confluence page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an advanced roadmap on jira (plan) for a new project
# create 11k issues or more on that project
# paste the roadmap's link to a confluence page and publish it

h3. Expected Results
The page should load, taking a similar time as Jira does to load the roadmap

h3. Actual Results
The roadmap fails to load, with an error after 10 seconds. The request to {{/wiki/plugins/servlet/portfolio-proxy}} fails with a 504 (gateway timeout) after 10 seconds.


h3. Workaround
Decrease the number of issues listed in the plan, in order to decrease the loading time to 10s
or less.
fields.summary: Advanced roadmaps from Jira timeouts after 10s

fields.description:
Error messages on failure for default assignee are not very clear. Some examples below:

When removing access from Jira for a user that is a default assignee, no warning is provided.

No warning on changing a workflow that will fail because of the default assignee.

Changes on the permission scheme, removing possible assign for the default assignee are also not warned.

When using the Inline Issue Create feature _(What needs to be done?)_, and failing to assign, no clear message is provided.
fields.summary: Improve error handling for default assignee failures.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the past, the due date field was not supported by team-managed projects (formally known as Next-gen).

That field is now supported, but it will not be displayed as an option to be added to a workflow rule even though custom date fields are:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-17 at 14.40.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Add the field *Due date* as a possible option to be added to workflow rules.

h3. Workaround

Create automation rules that will populate a custom date field with the value set on *Due date*, and then use that custom field on the workflow rule.

* Rule for copying the value from Due date to the custom date field upon issue creation:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 10.03.45.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 10.03.51.png|thumbnail! 
* Rule for copying the value from Due date to the custom date field when Due date is edited on the issue:
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 10.04.30.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 10.04.49.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 10.05.01.png|thumbnail! 

Here's a recording showing the rules in action:  [^Custom date control.mp4]
fields.summary: Support the due date field on workflow rules inside team-managed projects

fields.description:
As  a user I want to query for issues where I am assigned via group in a group custom field.

 

Example:

CurrentUser in GroupsOfCurrentUser
fields.summary: JQL for current user in group custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing a sprint in the backlog, selecting a user avatar in the board header to filter issues by that assignee, the summed estimate totals are not updated to reflect the estimates from the filtered issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board that uses Original Estimate as its estimation statistic
 # Create two issues, set the Original Estimate to '1d' on both
 # Assign one of these issues to yourself
 # Create a new sprint from the backlog and add both previously created issues to it.
 # Note that the current summed total lozenge shows '2d'
 # Click your avatar in the board header to filter the issues to only those where you are the assignee

h3. Expected Results

Summed estimate total will reflect only the issues currently displayed. Based on the steps above, it should show '1d'.
h3. Actual Results

The summed estimate total still shows the unfiltered value for all issues in the sprint. Based on the above steps, it is still shown as '2d' despite there only being a single issue displayed with an original estimate of '1d'.
h3. Workaround

This appears to only be the case where the avatar based assignee filtering is used. Quick filters that explicitly specify a user do update the estimate totals as expected.
fields.summary: Avatar Assignee Filters Do Not Update Estimate Totals

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, next-gen boards can't filter sub-task issue types based on the Label. For Standard Issue Types, there is a filter for Label but this feature is currently missing for sub-tasks. Due to this missing feature, we are forced to add the same label to the parent issue of that child issue so that the search/filter function starts appearing.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if next-gen boards would allow you to filter sub-tasks based on Label, just like for other issue types.

h3. Why this is important
Due to this missing feature, on a nextgen board its impossible to filter sub-tasks based on Label

h3. Workaround
Update the parent issue with the same label as the sub-task
fields.summary: Enable "Label" filter for sub-task issue types in next-gen boards

fields.description:
Currently, DevOps Smart Values range is limited to the fields outlined under [this documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-development/].

As a user of Jira and BitBucket it would be nice to have more fields, such as *pull request description*, that could be added as a comment of an issue with A4J. 

Similar request in here https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1997 albeit this one seems limited to user smart value as opposed to general such as id and description.
fields.summary: DevOps Smart Value should include more fields

fields.description:
Hi,

 

It’s would be great to be able to define a template for the description field.

 

*User story:*
 # User click on button to create a issue.
 # On create view the description field is pre-filled (photo montage)

[!https://aws1.discourse-cdn.com/atlassiandeveloper/optimized/3X/7/0/70ce129436210095929e2b736288fe060d2ed68d_2_615x500.png|width=615,height=500!|https://aws1.discourse-cdn.com/atlassiandeveloper/original/3X/7/0/70ce129436210095929e2b736288fe060d2ed68d.png]
image1042×847 23.9 KB

 

*Why this suggestion:*
Because when a user create an issue often he forgets elements to describe it correctly (for example, describe browser name, add a screenshot, when the problem occurred, …). In addition, certain users do not pay attention to the formatting of their message, it is difficult to read. So it’s will be nice to pre-fill description field.

What do you think ? Easy to develop ?

 

Thx
fields.summary: Template for issue description

fields.description:
Hi,

Per my unanswered community ticket which I loaded after searching the documentation I have the below issue and believe it to be a bug or at least a suggestion.

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Adjusting-date-format-to-show-EEE-dd-MMM-YY-in-Jira-Cloud/qaq-p/1709961]

As I have received no answers and cannot locate why this is not working in the documentation I am loading a ticket here.

 

I am wondering if I can get some help with Jira Cloud.

Currently in a ticket when I do /Date or // I get my date picker as usual and when selecting a date am shown *May 31, 2021*.

I want this field to display *Mon 31/May/2021* when I select the date.

I have undertaken the following,
 # Open the Jira Settings Cog
 # Selected System
 # Opened Look and Feel from the left hand side
 # Adjusted
 ## Day Format to EEE h:mm a
 ### Preview looks perfect
 ## Completed Date/time Format to EEE dd/MMM/yy h:mm a
 ### Preview looks perfect
 ## Day Month Year Format to EEE dd/MMM/yy
 ### Preview looks perfect
 ## ISO8601 is set to No
 # As this changed nothing I then starting searching the Community and saw a reference to checking my Default Language settings in General Settings
 ## I checked under General Configuration and it is set to English (United Kingdom)  as I am in Australia this is correct.
 ## So this rendered a dead end
 # There was then another answer about Advanced Settings
 ## I went in and used the links provided to enter EEE and %E in the relevant fields as pictured below.

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/145562i8621B4F454DFD82B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

I remain with the format displaying as May 31, 2021 when I refresh a ticket and go to // or /date a date in.  

Can anyone assist with what I am missing or have done wrong?

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Adjusting // date format to show EEE dd/MMM/YY in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the [release of roll-up dates|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Advanced-Roadmaps-articles/Introducing-roll-up-dates-for-Advanced-Roadmaps-Cloud/ba-p/1432119], it would be useful if there's an option to set the dates into Jira issues.

Currently, it is just within the plan's view.
fields.summary: Enable roll-up dates to be set into Jira issues

fields.description:
As recently observed, Jira seems to consider the week start on inclusive of the last days of previous year. But online tools seems to consider first Friday of the year. It is confusing when we need to create weekly reports in the Jira projects. 

It would be great if we can change this.
fields.summary: Consider the week to start on first Friday of the year

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using Firefox browser to start sprint cause the start date to display the javascript format instead of the date
%e/%b/aN %I:%M AM
Even using the default javascript dates at the look and feel:
 !image-2021-06-17-09-31-58-117.png|thumbnail! 
While attempting to start the sprint using the Firefox browser, the start date is displayed with the javascript format, making impossible to start the sprint on Firefox:
 !image-2021-06-17-09-33-30-132.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Scrum board using Firefox browser
# Try to start a sprint and the start date will be displayed with the javascript format

h3. Expected Results
The start date should be something with numbers as the end date

h3. Actual Results
The start date is displayed with the javascript format %e/%b/aN %I:%M AM

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior in Firefox, but, you can use Chrome to start the sprint.
fields.summary: Using Firefox browser to start sprint cause the start date to display the javascript format instead of the date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When issues are created via the Advanced Roadmap plan, the child issue panel does not show related child issue panel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the Create button
# Select the below fields:
Project: <select your project>
Issue Type: Initiative
Summary: <type Summary>
# Click on the Create button on the create screen to create your initiative
Then,
# Navigate to your advanced roadmap plan
# Locate the newly created Jira issue in step 3
# Click "..." button next to the Jira initiative issue you created earlier
# Click Create epic and enter the Issue summary
# Click on Review changes, select the newly created Epic and click Save selected changes in Jira

h3. Expected Results
* On the plan we should see the Hierarchy Initiative → Epic
* On the Initiative we should see the Epic under the Child issue panel
* On the Epic we should see the Initiative under the Parent Link

h3. Actual Results
* On the plan we should see the Hierarchy Initiative → Epic - This is reflecting ok
* On the Initiative we should see the Epic under the Child issue panel - *This is not showing*
* On the Epic we should see the Initiative under the Parent Link - This is reflecting ok

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Child issues panel doesn't show children is Jira issue view

fields.description: As a user, I would like for the Backlog/Releases/Roadmap to appear on the project left menu immediately after I've enabled it on the project board settings without having to refresh the page.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like for the Backlog or Releases to appear on the project left menu immediately without having to refresh the page

fields.description:
Currently when creating an automation rule with a manual trigger, it is only possible to limit the rule from being available on an issue by specifying user groups that can trigger the rule.

It would be great if more criteria can be added:
 # Project
 # Status
 # Issue Type
 # JQL
 # etc

It doesn't make sense to limit by groups because anyone in the instance should be allowed to run the rule, if they are aware of what it does and the conditions of the ticket are satisfied. Right now the rule would appear on every single issue in every project in a Jira instance and can get confusing to users for whom it's not relevant at all.
fields.summary: Limit Manual Automation Triggers to more criteria than just User Groups

fields.description:
Option to add more than 1 Confluence Spae to a Company Managed project

Use cases:
 * related knowledge is scattered among multiple Spaces;
 * a subset of knowledge needs to be shared among more Jira projects, but other topics are covered in specific Spaces.
fields.summary: Link Multiple Confluence Spaces to one Company Managed Project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Examples do not respect the date format set by user when Creating/Editing in versions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Project settings > Versions
# Create/Edit a version

h3. Expected Results
The dates that appear as suggestions are in the same format as the one the user has at the moment (currently the format is set by the user locale due to the changes from [JRACLOUD\-71304: New issue view: custom date/time format setting not respected in the new view|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71304]).

h3. Actual Results
The dates that appear as suggestions are in the YYYY/MM/DD: 
 !image-2021-06-16-15-35-37-816.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Examples do not respect the date format set by user when Creating/Editing in versions

fields.description:
Currently the date format on Advanced Roadmap is set to dd/MMM/yy and it is not configurable. 

Customers would like to ability to change the format to their preferred selected date format. For example: MM/DD/YYYY
fields.summary: Ability to change the date format on an Advanced Roadmap plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new issue view might be unable to show all sprints as results on the Sprint field depending on the amount as well as the names used on your sprints.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 For example, create the following sprints:
 * R&D Sprint Ending 6/16/2021
 * R&D Sprint Ending 6/30/2021
 * R&D Sprint Ending 7/14/2021
 * R&D Sprint Ending 7/28/2021
 * R&D Sprint Ending 8/11/2021
 * R&D Sprint Ending 8/25/2021

h3. Expected Results

showing all sprints

h3. Actual Results

There might have different results depending on your scenario:
* When searching on the sprint field, only *R&D Sprint Ending 8/25/2021* is displayed.
* If you create more sprints (with different naming, but in big quantity and following a pattern) the sprints mentioned as example might even stop being displayed as results on the Sprint field

h3. Workaround

In Backlog view, move the issue to the sprint that you want to set.
fields.summary: Sprint field in Jira Software (Cloud) Issue view not showing all sprints

fields.description:
Currently, adding the "Development" field in the card layout of a Jira software board, shows whether it has a "branch" or if the issue is under "review" from the development panel. 

Customers would like to see the number of reviewers and the users under the "Reviewer" section of the pull request in the Jira software boards.
fields.summary: Include additional information from the development panel in the card layout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a board uses a filter that includes multiple projects and sorts results using a custom field that is restricted in context to only some of those projects will cause said board to not load at all and throw 500 errors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field restricted to only show on some projects in the field's context.
# Create a filter that uses the field above to sort its results but includes more projects than the ones in the field's context.
# Use the filter from step 2 as a board filter.

h3. Expected Results
The board should load and throw an error that could indicate the user that the filter fails to load or sort the results. The board settings should be accessible.

h3. Actual Results
The board never loads. It sometimes throws an error but no specific message is displayed.

The below exception is thrown in Jira's logs:
{noformat}
Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (CUSTOM_FIELD). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Updating the filter to not sort using the custom field will correct the problem; however this can only be changed by the user if the filter used by the board is saved because the board settings become inaccessible.
fields.summary: Using a filter with multiple projects that sorts by a custom field that is restricted in context breaks the board that uses said filter.

fields.description:
As a logged in user, who have filtered out tasks assigned to myself, when I open a task being on agile board, next I assign task to another user I should be able to choose next task.

*What is wrong:* Page is reloading after assignee changed, and (x) clicked to close overlay, and it is trying to open previously opened task, which is not available, as I set filter to show only mine issues.

*Expected:* Task should remain closed.
fields.summary: Agile board should not reload endless after task is assigned to another user
Ability to search by "progress (issue count)" via Advanced JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Page freezes when the board has 10 or more issues in one column and you want to drag issues in the same column, it depends on the position but if you try to drag the issue from the bottom to the top the page freezes.

I replicated the problem with 10 issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 10 or 20 issues in one board and make them be part of the same column
 # Try to drag the issue from the bottom to the top

Video:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/RBulOORg

h3. Expected Results
The issues should be able to be dragged without problems to the desired position

h3. Actual Results
The page freezes and most of the time the browser sends a warning of no response

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page freezes when the board has a lot of issues and you want to drag them in the same column

fields.description:
Currently, it is possible to hide done subtasks inside issues, it would be very helpful to have the option to have custom filters like the quick filters in the backlog/board.
 !image-2021-06-11-11-28-46-555.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add custom filters for subtasks inside the issues

fields.description:
Currently comments are standalone, you have to remember to @ someone to tag them and comments get confusing when multiple things are being discussed.

The ability to have threaded conversations and reply to comments would be very helpful
fields.summary: Ability to reply to comments on issues and created threaded conversations
Cannot save changes if components with the same name are grouped together

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when going to the issues section in a Jira Software Project, the columns are fixed, regardless of the filter.

It would be useful for users to be able to add or remove columns.
h3. Workaround

Use the list view in the issue navigator to add/remove columns of interest.
fields.summary: As a user I'd like to add/remove columns directly in the project's issues section

fields.description: Our team withdrew a story in May 2021. It has a Sprint associated with it, but did not appear in the Backlog under that Sprint. When we reviewed points and items in that Sprint, the story and points did not appear. However when we started the Sprint, the item and points are in our active Sprint.
fields.summary: Withdrawn Issues Should Not Have a Sprint Field

fields.description:
Hello Jira folks!

I've been building a board with the intent to be user-friendly to all orgs that need the information. This includes both Sales and more technical folks.

But, as part of this, it needs to be incredibly intuitive. This suggestion would greatly improve the intuition and UX for using filters on a board.


*Current State:*

Right now, any quick-filters on a board are listed out in a single long list. This list is "organizable" in the sense that you can re-order your quick filters, but you cannot group them. Eventually this may become cumbersome to navigate as different types of filters are created, and more options are added.

See Screenshot 1

!image-2021-06-10-10-54-44-333.png|width=974,height=172!

*Suggested State:*

I would like to be able to group quick-filters, so that someone unfamiliar with Jira can better leverage these filters intuitively.

See Screenshot 2 (photoshopped)

!image-2021-06-10-10-55-54-581.png|width=887,height=216!

 

*Configuration*: I suspect to handle custom naming, you could have a + button in the configuration quick filter page, allowing a user to add as many "buckets" as they would like, and assign a name to each. All other functionality within these would behave like the "QUICK FILTER" object in the product today.
fields.summary: Organizational "Buckets" for Quick-Filters :: View Board Page

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In some cases, the status of the repo sync shows a failed status despite being synced correctly in the background.
 !error dvcs.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Go to the DVCS Accounts page
- Link Jira Cloud to Github
- Sync repositories.

h3. Expected Results
All repositories should be synced correctly, showing the last activity of the repositories on the DVCS Accounts page.

h3. Actual Results
For some reason, DVCS sometimes internally fails to transition the state of the repository from "in sync" to "sync was successfully finished". So it shows an error on the DVCS admin page.

* Even though the repositories seemed to be failed on the DVCS admin page, they are actually being synched
* The commit messages, and pull requests for linking repositories to projects are visible in Jira.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround.

h3. Notes
Review issues on projects related to some commits to confirm if it's syncing in the background. If they are, kindly ignore the message on DVCS page while this bug is still open. Otherwise, troubleshoot.
fields.summary: DVCS sometimes fails to transition the state of repo sync

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recently we came across an issue where filtering child issues of a Parent did not work correctly and there were some child issues missing. We came to notice that the issue had multiple parent links in the backend.

This request is for cleaning up database of any references to custom field of type Parent Link or any such duplication that are not the original Advanced roadmap Parent Link .
h3. Workaround

Change the issue type from Epic to standard-issue type ( story/task/bug) and then convert it back to Epic. Re-linking to correct parent would then fix the issue for now
fields.summary: Clean up of old parent links required to prevent any discrepancies

fields.description:
This will help in the particular case when the Sprint start date is changed to a date in the past, currently when doing that Jira considers that issues were added after the Sprint started causing the guideline in the burndown chart to disappear and there is no way to change the date when issues are added to the Sprint so Jira can consider that the Sprint was started with issues in it.

Note: If you return the start date to the one when the issues were added, the guideline will not recover.
fields.summary: Add the ability to change manually the date when an issue is added in a Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Re-opening an Epic does not add that epic back to the backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an Epic.
* Mark the Epic as *Done* from the backlog *Epic* section.
* Click on *Confirm* in the below popup
* However the Epic status is still in *To Do* status.
* Moved it to Done and re-opened the Epic 

h3. Expected Results
Epic should be added back to the backlog.

h3. Actual Results
The Epic does not show up back in the backlog.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Re-opening an Epic does not add that epic back to the backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently,  Original Story Points is not available in the new experience, only under legacy Live plans interface in Advanced Roadmaps

h3. Suggested Solution

Add this field to the new experience.
fields.summary: Add Original Story Points field to Advanced Roadmaps new interface

fields.description: Having a separated permission to delete a Team in Advanced Roadmaps would avoid users with edit permission to delete those.
fields.summary: Separated permission to delete Shared Teams in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Select List type fields, all options are always seen in the Scope view even when disabled from the field context.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field using the Select List field type and add several options in the field context
# Disable some of the options you've created
# Add the custom field to your Plan in _Manage Custom Fields_
# Open the drop-down options for the field from the Scope

 !Configure_Custom_Field__Select_List__single_choice__-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The options that are disabled are expected to be hidden just like it is in the issue view.

 !_TST7-35__TEST_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

All options are visible including the disabled ones.

 !Scope_view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior besides deleting the option assuming this is even an option for your team. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disabled Select List options are visible in the Scope view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Hide completed issues older than* option in the general settings for Kanban Boards are limited to 1, 2 and 4 weeks. To see issues older than these time windows you're forced to use the _Never mind, show all_ option which overloads the Board.

h3. Proposed solution

Expanding the options to 2, 3 and 5 months would allow the possibility of expanding the date range of completed issues teams want to have visible on their Board. Another solution would be to have customizable date ranges for this function.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use the _Never mind, show all_ option and adjust your Saved Filter to exclude unwanted issues by including a {{resolved >= -10w}} in your JQL.
fields.summary: Expand the Hide completed issues older than

fields.description:
Hi all, in the context of our company trasformation program, we are evauating possibility to use Jira Software as common tool for SW development lyfe cycle: we are currently in feasibility phase and we identified the need to have in Jira SW cloud the following capability:

 
 * We actually need possibility to choose values in a filed, that are showed dependently on the value of anoth other field, for example:
 ** We define a field *Digital Channels*, wich allows single selection out of several values e.g.: *APP*, *WEB*, *Payment Engine*, etc
 ** We define a new field "Channel Details" that, as an example, shows as possible values *APP X* , *APP Y*, *APP Z*, in case previous filed value was APP. 

It shall then be possible to assign these new fileds to any issue type (standard or custom created)

We would appreciate Your promt feedbac on this request, as this feature would be stringly required in order to fulfill with our data model.

Kindly advise in case of any additional information are required.

Thanks i advance and Best Regards // Marco

P.S.: i could not find suitable component to select for this request, so ust picked "Automation Rule - DevOPS trigger)
fields.summary: Possibility to chain value in field depending on other field

fields.description:
I would love the ability to have the *option to copy a project* when creating a new project.

When we create a new project presently I have to share the settings with an existing project that is not practical because once the project wants to make some changes I have to separate them and go back to the project and copy and rename the screens, schemes, etc..

If you create a second option to *copy* this will secure my project and make all the changes I want without impacting other projects and a lot more user friendly.

Copy project settings and rename it with new project key or not that would be easier to edit the name then create all the schemes etc.. 

Thanks for taking this into consideration asap.

Denise
fields.summary: Create an option to copy a project when creating a new project

fields.description:
Here i have 2 topics about it

1) [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-copy-the-last-part-of-links/qaq-p/1710786#M210474]



2) [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-show-links-as-a-links/qaq-p/1698978#U1707717]

 

You can find there wide messages about this situation.
There is screenshots, explanations, etc. 

 

(not sure about Component part of issue, but i mean the view of links when you add them to task or comments)
fields.summary: Links displaying must have an optional view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on unlink dependency button on roadmap doesn't remove the issue dependency.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on dependency line or dependency icon on the Bar.
 # Click unlink button.
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-07 at 10.45.44 am.png|width=442,height=260!

h3. Expected Results

It should remove the issue dependency.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.
h3. Workaround

Click on one of the issues forming the dependency relationship to open up the issue details view and remove issue link from there.
fields.summary: Remove dependency on Jira Roadmap is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a Release Note in Jira Software, the changes you apply to it are not kept after saving the change. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the Releases page for a Software project
# Click on the Release you want
# Click on *Release Note*
# Change the Release Notes there. 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should keep the change after saving it.
h3. Actual Results
Jira revert any change made to the previous value. 
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Some free third-party add-ons that could potentially help:
* [Automated Release Notes for Jira (Free)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1223567/automated-release-notes-for-jira-free?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
* [Release Notes for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1226232/release-notes-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Editing a Release Note and saving it does not keep the change on it

fields.description:
It will improve the possibilites of automation having functions like:
 * Listing sprints
 * Accessing their status

In my particular use case, we'd like to get a list of all Sprints with certain criteria and send a notification with the Sprint names. There doesn't seem to have a way to achieve that at this moment.
fields.summary: Automation - Improve Sprint funcionalities - List Sprints

fields.description:
When using a Sprint Update trigger, {{{{Sprint}}}} smart values ({{{{sprint.name}}}} , {{{{sprint.isStarted}}}}) will consider the sprint just added.

There are cases we would like to access the information from the Sprint the issue was removed from.
fields.summary: Automation - Add access to smart values from the Sprint just removed from an issue

fields.description:
Hi team,

While attempting to delete a sprint that has two or more projects, I would like a better error message that mentions the problem and which project the issues are in.
Currently this the error message that appears:
 !image-2021-06-03-11-49-49-781.png|thumbnail! 

As you can see the error message does not indicate in which permission scheme or project you lack permission.

Thank you in advance!
fields.summary: Better error message while attempting to delete a sprint that has two or more projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to update the epic link to the Story issue type, the Epics in 'Done' status are listed even when the "Show done epics" is unchecked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an epic issue type and move this to 'Done' status.
 # Try updating the epic link name of the story issue type and uncheck the "Show done epics".

h3. Expected Results
Epics in 'Done' status should not be listed. 

h3. Actual Results

Epics in done status are listed.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating the epic link in issues, lists epic in Done status too.

fields.description:
Atlassian Microsoft teams connector is not compatible with Automation for Jira webhooks, it could be helpful that it supports these webhooks.

Microsoft has a connector called "Incoming webhook" that works but could not be fully compatible.
fields.summary: Add support to Automation webhooks with Atlassian Microsoft teams connector

fields.description: as a user, I want to be able to add Date Time Picker custom fields in Advanced Roadmaps
fields.summary: use data time picker in advanced roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After removing a user in Jira, the filters assigned to the user will be deleted from the instance, leading to Project's boards and Features not being displayed. When these are accessed, a blank page is shown.

(Note: there is also a problem with dashboards getting deleted when a user gets removed. Please see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76758. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User 2 creates a new project or filter.
 # Remove User 2 in Jira.
 # With another user, access the project's board or features page for the project created by User 2. 

h3. Expected Results

The board and Features work normally
h3. Actual Results

The Projects that use a filter owned by the delete/deactivate will break. 
h3. Workaround

contact Atlassian support
fields.summary: Boards cannot be accessed and filters get deleted when a user is deleted

fields.description:
[Releases panel] Releases panel renders an empty component when a FF or DevInfo provider does not have URL
h3. Issue Summary

Releases panel shows an empty component in the issue view and cannot be removed in the field configuration.

 !screenshot_anon.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Oath credentials
 # Select Development Information or Feature Flags
 # Leave the URL fields empty

h3. Expected Results

URL field should be required (otherwise it will show up blank in Releases panel)
h3. Actual Results

Releases panel will show "Releases" field with no component (blank)

h3. Workaround
Only workaround presently is to delete and recreate the Oath credentials, but this is not recommended as it deletes existing data related to this credential.
fields.summary: Releases panel renders an empty component when a FF or DevInfo provider does not have URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In its current state, Plan level permissions consist of either View plan or Edit plan with no possibility of restricting specific actions such as saving changes, changing team capacity and various others.

h3. Proposed solution

Apply an [+Advanced Roadmaps restricted user+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/permissions-in-advanced-roadmaps-934719058.html#PermissionsinAdvancedRoadmaps-restricteduser] permission so that the Plan level access can be more granular to specify who has access the certain actions, particularly:

* Saving changes
* Configure Plan settings
* Plan specific Team management
* Auto-scheduling
* Export and Share
fields.summary: Granular Plan level permissions

fields.description:
Customer on the related ticket pointed out few reasons for having a FF or a feature to disable notifications about new features. Listing here as mentioned by customer:

{quote} 
* Atlassian may not always add these new features to a permission scheme so there is no easy way for admins to control their use
* Admins get no chance to investigate the feature to decide who should be able to use it.
* There can be negative consequences to the business with some of these items (automation rule roll out was a prime example)
* This is a critical system that should never break because of an unrequested cloud push.
* Every time I see a new feature hit my system without warning I want to change to a different product. I've used Jira for a number of years. I used to be a cheerleader. Not anymore. This is just information for your PM's. {quote}
fields.summary: Capability to disable the in-product & email notification about any new features in Jira

fields.description:
As an automation rule writer, I want to enable *verbose audit logging* when developing a rule so that I can more rapidly build and validate a rule, without the need to add/remove audit log actions or debug statements.

Acceptance criteria:
 * on rule details, I can select an option for verbose audit logging
 * the default value of verbose audit logging is disabled
 * when verbose audit logging is enabled, details of component process are logged the same as if the debug qualifiers were added
 * when verbose audit logging is enabled, *all* issues acted upon in the rule are logged.  (currently triggers, branches, etc. truncate the display of information logged which is available to Jira users)
 * bonus: audit log list provides a visual indicator that verbose information is available without the need to expand the log entry display

Business case:

While automation for Jira continues to evolve and improve, the documentation and knowledge of this feature is still growing.  Thus rule development and validation is often a trial and error process.  Providing a built-in mechanism for verbose audit logging will help rule writers accelerate their writing by eliminating the need to add/remove individual actions for logging or debug qualifiers.  This new feature would also reduce errors which could occur when the removal of manual logging is done.
fields.summary: add a *verbose audit logging* option to automation rule details

fields.description:
As an automation rule writer, I want to pin frequently used actions to the top of the editor component selector, so I can create rules more rapidly

Acceptance criteria:
 * once add action is selected in the editor, a rule writer may pin an action to the top of the list
 * a "pinned actions" section replaces the "recommend actions" section
 * a pinned action may be unpinned, removing it from the top section
 * the list of pinned actions persists by Jira user

Business case:

There are many great actions available for automation rules.  However many users use just a small set of them based upon their use cases.  Reducing the need to search (or scroll) every time an action is needed will save time and reduce errors in rule creation.
fields.summary: add pin actions to automation rule editor

fields.description: Proposing the creation of an Initiative Report & Initiative Burndown Reports like the Epic Report & Epic Burndown so that you can see the break down of the work for an Initiative.
fields.summary: Reporting capability for JIRA issue type Initiative like the Epic Report & Epic Burndown

fields.description:
I hope this is the correct place for this. As discussed here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/When-are-the-workflow-triggers-for-branches-going-to-deprecate/qaq-p/1611693] , there is concern in the community around the deprecation of workflow triggers. Many of us are already hitting our automation limits monthly, and without the ability to simply purchase plans to increase automation limits, we're asked to double our Jira subscription costs. 

While I understand that we can set rules for individual projects, this just isn't feasible when I have 100s of projects on a small team or 1000s for larger teams. One thing changes in that workflow and you're asking us to update 1000 individual rules. 

Please reconsider the current published solutions and offer better options for your users.

!image-2021-05-28-08-35-38-800.png!
fields.summary: Do not deprecate Workflow Triggers or allow automation plans to increase automation limits

fields.description:
We need to be able to see not only the date visually for the epic, but also for the issues/tasks/bugs and Child issues for them. It's hard to get a overveiw of an epic, when the only shown date on the map is the epic... It would be more usable if we could se the assignments under the epic and the how they block or link to each other.

 

We could be able to live without seeing the child issue on the map, not perfereble, but we can't go on not having the assignments under the epic.

 

I have tried to show what I mean in af little simpel mock-up under here:

*+ROADEMAP+*

{color:#403294}*EPIC*                            **  {color} **  *|_____________|*

{color:#0747a6}     *Issue/task/bug      {color:#172b4d}  {color:#0747a6}|_____|{color}{color}*{color}

{color:#4c9aff}          *Child Issue       {color:#172b4d}      {color:#4c9aff} |__|{color}{color}*{color}

 {color:#0747a6}    {color}*{color:#0747a6}Issue/task/bug {color}                {color:#0747a6} |_____|{color}*

          *{color:#4c9aff}Child Issue {color}                      {color:#4c9aff}  |__|{color}*
fields.summary: Roadmap - See issues under Epic

fields.description:
As a Project Manager (waterfall and agile) who is using heavily CFD for :
 ** monitor output
 ** forecast % delivery
please, will need be added visual forecast as suggested below:

 !Screenshot 2021-05-28 at 11.15.59 AM.png|thumbnail! 

In the above CFD, please add an indication about the count of the Issues at the Start and End of the graph.

Or

Add a table beneath the Graph that should tell about the count of issues especially at the start and end of duration and through the duration selected.

This visual representation helps in reporting and stakeholders, able to review and visualize the data more accurately.
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Diagram should show the count of issues at the start and end of the selected duration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "View in issue navigator" link about the Scope changes log in the Next-gen burndown report should only link to issues that are listed in the log.

Currently, it is listing issues that do not appear in the log.

 

!2021-05-28 at 12.53 pm.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a sprint with an issue in it

 # Transition this issue to done

h3. Expected Results
 * The Scope changes log remains empty

 * There is no “View in issue navigator” link above the scope changes log

h3. Actual Results
 * The Scope changes log remains empty (/)

 * “View in issue navigator” link appears above the scope changes table with the issue that was transitioned to Done (x)

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Nextgen Burndown report scope changes log displays incorrect issues in issue navigator link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 The Version Report Gadget doesn't work in a dashboard after been set with a board and version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open or create a new dashboard;
 # Add the Version Report Gadget and associate it to a board and version.
 # Set the Refresh Interval and click save;
 # The gadget tries to load but fails. 
 # [^Version Report Gadget.mp4]

h3. Expected Results

The Version Report Gadget should load properly at the dashboard. 
h3. Actual Results

The gadget tries to load and fails, but doesn't show any errors. 

!Test dashboard.png!
h3. Workaround

No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Setting the "Version Report Gadget" in a dashboard doesn't load the gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When there are many projects starting with the same name  for example *TROJ* nucleo, *TROJ* sun. *TROJAN* etc ,the project does not come up under the filter section to grant access to the projects. 
If we type TROJ, the TROJ* nucleo does not come up, which makes the users believe that there is a problem and the project cannot be assigned.

Attaching an example where the issue can be replicated

h3. Environment
JS
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a huge number of projects, starting with the same name 
Edit a filter ( select filters from top, take a filter and then edit that filter)
You will see, where you can select a project to give access as shown in the snapshot below.



h3. Expected Results
The search results should match the first name given. Here for ex: you will see Businproj comes up with matching on project and not all matches comes up for project( Attached snapshot)( project-project lead missing)

h3. Actual Results
The search results should retrieve all the results matching the name and should show the closest matching ones on the top.

h3. Workaround
Need to type in the entire string or matching letters to the second part of the project name

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Search results for project under filter does not return results correctly

fields.description: In Jira server I could use the location {{atl.jira.version.admin.operations}} to add an extra web item to the drop down menu on the releases page. I was able to access the parameter {{version.id}} when I did this. It would be great if I could do this in Jira cloud as well.
fields.summary: Add UI location for release operations drop down

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Basic search doesn't show the Options for Epic Status field if there is at least one Team managed project with issuetype=Epic

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Team managed project and ensure it has issue type Epic
# Select Advanced Issue search
# In Basic search mode, select issue type Epic
# Add Epic Status field

h3. Expected Results
Epic status options To do, In Progress, and Done have to be available.

h3. Actual Results
To do, In Progress, and Done options are not available.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

A possible workaround is to use Advanced Search.
fields.summary: Basic search doesn't show the Options for Epic Status field if there is at least one Team managed project with issuetype=Epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you clear or add 0 to the story points of an issue, regardless if you do it within the sprint or first remove the issue from the sprint and add it back, charts will pick up the last known value.
 * if you want to reduce the work scope on a burnup chart, it is not enough to change the story points to 0 or clear that field. You have to remove the issue from the sprint.
 * if you remove an issue from a sprint and clear or set to 0 the story points and add it back to the sprint, charts will pick up the last known value again.

I tested the situation with burnup chart, but most probably burn down is affected too.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a sprint with some issues having story points
 # change the story points of an issue to 0 or just clear that field
 # remove an issue from the sprint, change the story point to 0 or clear that field, add the issue back to the sprint

h3. Expected Results

Burnup chart is consistent with the changes
h3. Actual Results

If story points is set to 0 or cleared, burn up chart picks up the last known value of the issue
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: burnup charts take the last known value for story points, if that field is set to 0 or cleared

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a filter that will filter out all the issue in an epic (Epic is in cross project/same project), in the board settings when swimlane is selected as Epic, we see empty board rather than issues part of the Epic.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter which has a Epic link
 # Create a board with the filter. 
 # In the board settings, choose swimlanes as "Epic".
 # You will see empty board.

This occurs even if the filter has epics within the same project.

!image-2021-05-27-14-18-02-114.png|width=342,height=182!
h3. Expected Results

Epic name should be there is in the swimlane and the related child issues in the board.
h3. Actual Results
h3. !image-2021-05-27-14-19-12-010.png|width=340,height=123!
h3. Workaround

To use other swimlanes instead of Epic
fields.summary: Epic swimlane does not work as expected

fields.description: We prefer to use a different workflow discussing additional needs.
fields.summary: As an Site Admin, I need to disable "app request" functionality

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Having the following hierarchy:
 # Program
 # Initiatives
 # Epic
 # Story
 # Subtask

The user have a massive list of *Initiatives* in the *Parent Link* field when creating an *Epic*
h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to set a *Parent Link* based on a "Grandparent", or a Program in this specific scenario.

The intention is to have in the UI of the issue view a cascading hierarchical Parent Link field, very similar to what we have in the Advanced Roadmaps plan:

  !Captura de Tela 2021-05-25 às 18.12.07.png|thumbnail!
h3. Why This Is Important

If the site have a massive number of issues available in the Parent Link would be much easier for the user to go to the grandparent first and then see only the subset underneath instead of scroll through a tones of possible parents.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: Ability to choose the parent link based on a grandparent - Cascading Hierarchical parent link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The use case was specific to Parent Link. Some users would like to have them opened on the same window, others on a new tab or window. Allowing the user to select the default behavior would be nice.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue with a Parent Link
 # Click the Parent Link
 # It opens on a new tab by default

h3. Expected Results

User should have the option to open on the same tab.
h3. Actual Results

It opens on a new tab.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like the option to choose the how clicking on links opens the window (same tab/new tab/new window)

fields.description:
At the moment, Team-managed and Company-managed have different UI when accessing backlog. 

This difference between these two type of projects can cause some issues mainly for users that use both project types. 

h3. Suggestion
Use the same UI for both project types, Team-managed and Company-managed. 

h3. List of elements that are different on backlog:
* Displaying an issue status (Missing at Company-managed)
* Sprint container (Missing at Company-managed)
fields.summary: Team-managed and Company-managed backlog should have the same UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sprint start date is not entered properly when the language setting is set to Japanese. "%e/%b/aN %I:%M 午前" is entered in sprint start date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the language setting to Japanese.
 # Create a scrum project
 # Try to start a sprint (Click "Start sprint" button)

h3. Expected Results
Sprint start date is entered automatically

h3. Actual Results
"%e/%b/aN %I:%M 午前" is entered in sprint start date. You can't start a sprint until you manually select the date.
 !AtlassianSupport 2021-05-24 15.16.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint start date is not entered properly
Improve in-app messaging to clarify how the most-right in Software Boards column affects issues and reports

fields.description: the customers would like to customize the board's cards in Team-managed projects as we have in [company-managed||https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/customize-cards/]
fields.summary: customize cards in team managed project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The {color:#4C9AFF}View in issue navigator{color} link from the *Scope changes log* of the Sprint burndown chart brings you to the issue navigator including inconsistent results with what's presented in the chart.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a Sprint and make a bunch of scope changes by adding issues, removing issues, changing estimation, etc...
# In the Sprint burndown chart go to the *Scope changes log* and click on the {color:#4C9AFF}View in issue navigator{color} link

h3. Expected Results

You should be directed towards the issue navigator with a list of issues that reflect what you see in the scope changes.

 !Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The list of issues includes everything that's in the scope changes in addition to many more issues with no clear reason as to why nor does it match with the total amount of the other sections like Incomplete issues, Completed issues or Issues completed outside of sprint.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scope changes log gives inconsistent search results in the issue navigator

fields.description:
Hi Team,

As per the recent observations that we made in the support tickets that has been raised, having the same sprint name in two different projects/same project/same project different boards causing confusion in the reporting process. 

We may need to scan the names and avoid the same name use case would be really of great help.
fields.summary: Ability to disallow using same sprint name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Advanced Roadmap, when using the option "Use sprint dates when issues don’t have start and end dates", if the Sprint does have specified dates, a projected start and due date will show on the plan

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to advanced roadmap
# Settings > Configure > General > Scheduling > select "Use sprint dates when issues don’t have start and end dates"
# add an issue to a future sprint
# do not set start and end date for the issue
# do not set start and end date for the sprint

h3. Expected Results
If the Future Sprint does not have defined start and end dates, as a user I would like to have the option to turn on/off future sprint projection

h3. Actual Results
Currently, Roadmap plan will add projection dates on the plan

See screenshots:
Sprint does not include dates:
 !image-2021-05-20-16-14-14-617.png|thumbnail! 

Issue does not include dates:
 !image-2021-05-20-16-14-35-208.png|thumbnail! 

Plan reflects projected dates: 
 !image-2021-05-20-16-14-56-510.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add an option to turn on/off future sprint projection dates for issues

fields.description:
The user tries to get to custom fields in plans, gets an error that there are too many redirects. Clears browser cookies, history, etc. Same error. Tries another browser.

 !image-2021-05-19-19-08-26-519.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2021-05-19-19-08-43-981.png|thumbnail! 

URL with the error when you are non- Admin --> https://swibwi.atlassian.net/login?application=jira&dest-url=%2Fsecure%2Fadmin%2FViewCustomFields.jspa&permission-violation=true

The error on the page should just say you need permissions! because the customers are trying to troubleshoot this error.
fields.summary: Bad error message for non-admin user trying to get to custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an automation rule is configured to trigger on the Sprint started event and is pointed to a personal board, starting sprints on that board does not trigger the rule.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new board
 # When prompted to name the board, change the location to your user account
 !image-2021-05-19-15-18-50-678.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create an automation rule using the sprint started trigger
 # Configure the trigger to point at the board created above

h3. Expected Results
Sprints started on the board trigger the automation rule

h3. Actual Results
The rule is not triggered. The rule is successfully triggered if it is pointed at a board that is associated with a project rather than a user account.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint Started Trigger Not Firing for Personal Boards

fields.description:
As of today, Administrator, Member & Viewer are available. We can create a role but only at the project level.

 

It would be great if you could create additional roles with predefined permissions made available for existing or new projects. This would avoid having to create a custom role manually in every project.

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Global role with default permission in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the *Priority* field is not available as an option for the _Color by_ drop-down in the view settings. See [Add Color To Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/add-color-to-issues-998651123.html].

h3. Proposed solution

Include the *Priority* field as a coloring option as this would allow for a visually meaningful view for a high-level overview of what's a top priority and what isn't.

 !Color_by_Priority.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Color by priority on view settings
Renaming "Days Remaining" in a sprint with "Working Days Remaining" to make it more user-friendly

fields.description: Availability to show the full path of the breadcrumb in the issue view for Hierarchy of Advanced Roadmaps.
fields.summary: Ability to show the full path of the breadcrumb in the issue view for Hierarchy of Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

Dependencies Report in Advances Roadmps doesn't include a scroll-bar. Right now the default scrolling action (i.e with a mouse wheel or touchpad) enables you to zoom-in or zoom-out. However, a scroll bar would be a lot more effective to navigate when there are many dependencies to be displayed.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Having a scroll bar and perhaps some way of arranging the layout of the report would be good to have as it'd be more effective to navigate when there are a large number of dependencies.
fields.summary: Add ability to scroll on Dependencies report

fields.description: Using a sprint name more than once on different boards can result in unexpected behavior such as using filters and selecting the respective sprint name(we are not sure which sprint name is correct). It would be great if we provide a warning message when a user is creating a sprint with a name that is already in use?
fields.summary: Warning when creating duplicate sprint name

fields.description: the user wants to have an entry in the audit log for when someone makes changes in the instance's email handlers.
fields.summary: Loh in audit log who made changes in the email handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The value selected for the *Team* field does not retain upon closing the issue.

h3. Cause
Customer’s license expired and the Advanced Roadmap feature was taken away. So, the *Team* field will not be saved as it is part of the feature.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the issue and make a selection for the *Team* field
# Close the issue view and open the same issue again
# The *Team* field is empty

h3. Expected Results
I would expect it to show with some sort of error message when the user is selecting the value in the *Team* field.

h3. Actual Results
Everything looks okay and seems the issue was saved without any issue.
But the user will only find out that the field is empty when they revisited the same issue again. Otherwise, no one wouldn’t have known that the value wasn’t saved.
*No error at all*

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The selection made in "Team" field will not retain after closing the issue

fields.description:
Currently completed releases automatically disappear from the timeline view. This makes recent and important accomplishments disappear when people may need to see them most. 

Senior people often only care about the top line releases as they represent when something will be available for use or impacted teams and leaders need to be informed. Investment bodies need to know what has been completed, not just what is coming in the future. 

 

*Suggest an option to show or hide completed releases to avoid clutter. Completed releases should have an indicator they are done when viewed on the timeline (e.g. a check mark).* 

 

This would bring the tool inline with competitors and how people would portray the information in a PowerPoint.
fields.summary: Option to hide or show completed releases
